01-01.title: Hank Williams dies
01-01.description: On January 1, 1953, country legend Hank Williams dies at the age of just 29. His songs like 'Your Cheatin' Heart' had a lasting impact on country music.

01-08.title: Elvis Presley is born
01-08.description: On January 8, 1935, Elvis Aaron Presley is born in Tupelo, Mississippi. He would later become known as the 'King of Rock and Roll' and revolutionize popular music.

01-15.title: Wikipedia launches
01-15.description: On January 15, 2001, Wikipedia goes online. This platform later becomes one of the most important sources for music knowledge and band histories worldwide.

02-03.title: The Day the Music Died
02-03.description: On February 3, 1959, Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and J.P. 'The Big Bopper' Richardson die in a plane crash. Don McLean later immortalized this day in the song 'American Pie'.

02-09.title: Beatles on The Ed Sullivan Show
02-09.description: On February 9, 1964, The Beatles make their first appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show. 73 million Americans tune in - the beginning of 'Beatlemania' in the USA.

03-06.title: Pink Floyd forms
03-06.description: On March 6, 1965, Pink Floyd give their first concert at the Countdown Club in London. The band would later become one of the most influential progressive rock bands.

04-05.title: Kurt Cobain dies
04-05.description: On April 5, 1994, Kurt Cobain, frontman of Nirvana, is found dead. His death marks the end of the grunge era of the early 90s.

05-26.title: Miles Davis is born
05-26.description: On May 26, 1926, Miles Davis is born. He becomes one of the most influential jazz musicians of all time, shaping various jazz eras from bebop to fusion.

06-01.title: Sgt. Pepper's is released
06-01.description: On June 1, 1967, The Beatles release 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band'. The album is considered a milestone in popular music and the beginning of the concept album.
06-01.album: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band

06-18.title: Paul McCartney is born
06-18.description: On June 18, 1942, Paul McCartney is born in Liverpool. As bassist and songwriter for The Beatles, he becomes one of the most successful musicians in history.

07-06.title: Ringo Starr is born
07-06.description: On July 6, 1940, Richard Starkey, known as Ringo Starr, is born. He becomes The Beatles' drummer in 1962, completing the world's most famous band.

07-17.title: Disneyland opens
07-17.description: On July 17, 1955, Disneyland opens in California. The park later becomes an important venue for film music and Disney songs that shape generations of children.

08-15.title: Woodstock Festival begins
08-15.description: On August 15, 1969, the legendary Woodstock Festival begins. Over 400,000 people experience four days of 'Peace, Love and Music' with artists like Jimi Hendrix and Janis Joplin.

09-23.title: John Coltrane is born
09-23.description: On September 23, 1926, John Coltrane is born. The saxophonist becomes one of the most important jazz innovators, influencing countless musicians with his spiritual jazz.

10-09.title: John Lennon is born
10-09.description: On October 9, 1940, John Winston Lennon is born in Liverpool. As founder and creative mind of The Beatles, he becomes one of the most influential figures in popular music.

11-22.title: JFK is assassinated
11-22.description: On November 22, 1963, President Kennedy is assassinated. This event inspires countless songs, including 'Abraham, Martin and John' by Dion and many protest songs of the 60s.

12-08.title: John Lennon is murdered
12-08.description: On December 8, 1980, John Lennon is shot outside his apartment in New York. The world mourns the Beatles musician and peace activist.

12-25.title: Christmas music history
12-25.description: Christmas is the day when the most Christmas songs are played worldwide. 'White Christmas' by Bing Crosby is the best-selling single of all time.
